qas.question: What was the revival of Georgian style in twentieth century United States called?
Which Canadian group embraced Georgian architecture as a sign of fealty to Britain?
What Toronto building was built in 1817?
What English born architect designed the Old Montreal Custom House?
What was the Georgian style cold in the colonies?
Who embraced Georgian architecture as a sign of their British heritage
What style was dominant in the country for the second half of the nineteenth century?
What manner was built in Montréal in 1870?
When did John Ostell build the Grange?

context: In the early decades of the twentieth century when there was a growing nostalgia for its sense of order, the style was revived and adapted and in the United States came to be known as the <a0_0><b4_0>Colonial Revival<a0_0/>.<b4_0/> In Canada the <a1_0>United Empire <b5_0>Loyalists<b5_0/><a1_0/> embraced <b6_0>Georgian architecture<b6_0/> as a sign of their fealty to Britain, and the Georgian style was dominant in the country for most of the first half of the 19th century. <a2_0><b7_0>The Grange<b7_0/><a2_0/>, for example, a manor built in Toronto, was built in <b8_0>1817<b8_0/>. In Montreal, English born architect <a3_0>John Ostell<a3_0/> worked on a significant number of remarkable constructions in the Georgian style such as the Old Montreal Custom House and the Grand séminaire de Montréal.
